modules.title: The AI Lexicon
modules.description: Establish a common vocabulary for discussing AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning.
keyLearning: Differentiate between AI, ML, and Deep Learning
Understand the spectrum of AI (ANI, AGI, ASI)
Identify the three core learning paradigms

steps.title: AI Spectrum & Classifications
steps.content: Understanding the different types of artificial intelligence and how they relate to each other.

quiz.question: Which type of AI can perform any intellectual task that a human can do?
quiz.explanation: AGI represents AI that matches human cognitive abilities across all domains.

resources.title: The Three Types of AI
resources.content: Detailed explanation of ANI, AGI, and ASI...

steps.title: Machine Learning Fundamentals
steps.content: Core concepts of machine learning and its relationship to artificial intelligence.

quiz.question: Arrange these ML paradigms from least to most data requirement:
quiz.explanation: Supervised learning typically requires the most labeled data, while reinforcement learning can learn through trial and error.

steps.title: Deep Learning Architecture
steps.content: Understanding neural networks and deep learning principles.

quiz.question: What makes deep learning 'deep'?
quiz.explanation: Deep learning gets its name from the multiple layers in neural networks.

steps.title: Real-World Applications
steps.content: Exploring how AI, ML, and Deep Learning are applied in various industries.

quiz.question: AI applications are limited to technology companies only.
quiz.explanation: AI is being applied across all industries including healthcare, finance, transportation, agriculture, and more.

modules.title: The Practitioner's Toolkit
modules.description: Survey the key models and algorithms that form the basis for most AI applications.
keyLearning: Grasp the function of key models like Regression and Decision Trees
Understand the trade-off between model complexity and interpretability
Recognize which models are suited for which business problems

steps.title: Linear Models & Regression
steps.content: Understanding linear regression and its applications in predictive modeling.

quiz.question: Adjust the regression line to minimize the error:
quiz.explanation: The best fit line minimizes the sum of squared errors.

quiz.question: Build a decision tree to classify the given dataset:
What happens when you increase the number of hidden layers?
options: The model always becomes more accurate
The model may overfit to training data
quiz.explanation: More layers can lead to overfitting if not properly regulated.

steps.title: Model Selection & Evaluation
steps.content: Learn how to choose the right model and evaluate its performance.

quiz.question: What is the main purpose of cross-validation?
options: To assess model performance on unseen data
quiz.explanation: Cross-validation helps estimate how well a model will perform on new, unseen data.

modules.title: AI Project Frameworks & Use Cases
modules.description: Learn the industry-standard process for managing data science projects from concept to deployment.
keyLearning: Learn the 6 phases of the CRISP-DM framework
Analyze real-world case studies across industries
Identify potential AI use cases within your own function

quiz.question: Drag the CRISP-DM phases into the correct order:
Which industry benefit is correctly matched with its AI application?
Assess this business scenario for AI potential:

data.scenario: A retail company wants to predict customer churn

steps.title: Implementation Roadmap
steps.content: Creating a realistic roadmap for AI implementation in your organization.

quiz.question: What should be the first step in an AI implementation roadmap?
options: Buy the most advanced AI tools
Hire a team of data scientists
Assess current data infrastructure and quality
Start with the most complex use case
quiz.explanation: Understanding your data foundation is crucial before any AI implementation.
